newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH MUNICIPALITIES 1996 FINANCES IMPROVED - SF.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH MUNICIPALITIES 1996 FINANCES IMPROVED - SF.

text.p: Finnish municipal finances continued to strengthen in 1996, Statistics Finland (SF) said in a statement on Wednesday.

"Tax revenues rose by five billion markka, and even though state grants fell by three billion and expenditures increased, municipalities were able to reduce long-term debt by almost three billion compared to 1995," SF said.
Local government debt fell by 2.8 billion markka to 22.0 billion by end-1996 compared with a fall of 2.4 billion in 1995.
"The debt burden has eased by a quarter during the last three years," SF said. It was 29.9 billion markka at end-1993.
Total municipal expenditure was 146,3 billion markka last year, up by 4.3 billion over 1995.

Running expenses were 117.8 billion markka, up from 113.9 billion in 1995, debt-servicing costs fell to 17.9 billion from 18.1 billion and local government investment increased to 10.9 billion markka from 9.3 billion in 1995, SF said.
